Text:
For those interested in this information:
This file has been Certified Free of "Gross Pixelation Errors"
XVID just posted

AVIGUY
Yeah but 1.25gb?? I understand 720p and all but most are usually around the 900mb mark. If we don't reign this in now, when will the madness end?

Thanks!

These 720p files used to be bigger than 900mb, when they first made an appearance, so I don't see a problem with this size.
yeah indeed, if you mind the size, why dont you download 300mb ones oO truth be told i love it when i see 1.5gb ones, usually ends up with higher quality
Normally a top-notch 720p weighs ~1.34 gb, so this is getting off easy.

Hell no not going to download the 300mb ones. Just saying that most of the other 720p's are 800-900mb with near flawlessness. Don't see why it needs another 350mb tacked on it unless it's going to suck my dick at the end of the episode

Yeah seriously guys compression has gotten much better and so why download larger files than necessary? You could make the 720p file to be 2 GB if you wanted but why, right? So why make it 1.2 GB when it could easily be under a Gig? And what are "gross pixelation errors"? What is up with people today? This isn't 1990, it's almost 2013 people.
Thanks mate. Ignore the whining, size isn't everything; it's what you do with it.
Size is not a big concern to me. Lots of smaller files have annoying glitches. At least these big files are completely glitch free.

@Negumiko

Yes I agree with you. Have had problems myself with the 900mb size, where as the bigger ones never caused me any probs what so ever.

thanks for uploading , very good work  
great quality .
